title: ITC Avant Garde Gothic Not Avant Garde Gothic
content:
We are in a right state here.  
Having just won a pitch for a Art Gallery Programme.  
We used ITC Avant Garde Gothic in the material we put forward.  
only to then notice a city wide advertising campaign for a nightclub!  
using on type and its set in...ITC Avant Garde Gothic  
Can anyone out there recommend something similar but modern.  
We chose ITC Avant Garde Gothic because the new Art building is very square so the roundness of the typeface worked well against the building.

please help

Yours peed-off

Mr Brown

 [‹ Similar fonts to Akzidenz Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/typophile.com/node/36636 "Go to previous forum topic") [Changing InDesign CS2 Default Preferences? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/typophile.com/node/36630 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mr Brown

comments.content:
Lubalin Graph (Avant-Garde with slab serifs): [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/")

Futura (the “original” Avant Garde): [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/")

Gotham (strong geometrics, but with character): [http://www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html")

Neutraface (nice “old-school” look) : [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18 "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18")

Avenir Next is lovely. As is Apex Sans.

Might also want to see ...

Galaxie Polaris  
Paralucent  
Venus  
Linotype Litera  
Noir  
DIN Neuzeit Grotesk  
Bryant
And have a look at this [thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20071117073905/http:/typophile.com/node/36062) too.

What would I do without you lot.  
Thank you all so much.

Mr Brown
